subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Look Ma! No echo box.
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
Hi Frank,

Is there a way I can get a copy of your circuit layout?  I can open 
Express PCB files, although I haven't used them for any boards yet. It's 
usually far cheaper for me to make a board myself than have them do it.

A lot of the stuff I've been doing is for amateur radio microwave 
frequencies.  I usually make the circuit pattern with a CAD program, print 
it on transparent laser printer sheets, and use DATAK photoresist and 
developer to make boards.  I've been working with 10-mil thick Rogers 
Duroid 5880 board for 24 GHz and I have some of the 5-mil stuff, which is 
paper-thin.  But I wouldn't use any of that expensive stuff for your 
circuit. I have lots of G-10 too.

I didn't know about bdent.com.  Looks like a great resource for parts. 
Thanks!

Zack

On Sun, 21 Oct 2007, Frank Sumption wrote:

>
> I'm using the LA1816 (bdent.com), it needs only the oscillator coil, a 
> 455khz ceramic filter, and  a choke I wind by hand for AM, and pretty 
> much the same for FM. I add an AM RF amp so I can use a wire antenna. If 
> you can work with SMT compnents, I have a layout all done. I order the 
> boards from Express PCB for about $93 for two (min order), and if you 
> want the silk screen on the board, that doubles the cost. There are some 
> mistakes/changes to the current schematics that have been posted out on 
> the net, I have up dates, but they are at work, and I can't post it from 
> there, I keep forgetting to bring them home.   FM leaves something to be 
> desired, but I'm rearranging the two FM coils on the latest board layout 
> to see if that helps.  The component values are marked for the top side 
> with the silk screen, but there's no way to label the bottom from 
> Express PCB. There's some jumpers needed, and I think I have them all 
> labeled. You will have to down load the software from Express PCB to see 
> the layout http://www.expresspcb.com/
>
> Getting the board is the easy part, assembly and wiring, that takes some time!
>
> Frank-S
>
